description: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.

00:06:45.940 --> 00:06:46.650

00:06:46.650 --> 00:06:50.880

00:06:50.880 --> 00:06:55.910

00:08:15.578 --> 00:08:18.640

00:08:18.640 --> 00:08:22.333

00:08:23.982 --> 00:08:27.900

00:08:27.900 --> 00:08:32.178
And I can also identify you

00:08:32.178 --> 00:08:34.077
All right, so

00:08:34.077 --> 00:08:38.350

00:08:38.350 --> 00:08:43.237

00:08:49.190 --> 00:08:50.540

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the Command Prompt as well as Runline commands found in the Windows Operating System. Specific topics covered includes: Running cmd.exe as standard user vs. Administrator, getting help (/?), TASKLIST, TASKKILL, DIR, CD/MD/RD, COPY/DEL, XCOPY/ROBOCOPY, DISKPART, FORMAT, REGEDIT, SERVICES.MSC, MMC, MSTSC, MSINFO, DXDIAG and DEFRAG.

So it identifies the adapters uniquely,

right now, or it happens automatically,

553
00:28:51.950 --> 00:28:55.860
which they do happen automatically in the
background, certain things trigger that.

554
00:28:55.860 --> 00:28:59.640
You could take that virus or
that piece of malware and

555
00:28:59.640 --> 00:29:01.300
it could be in your system restore.

556
00:29:01.300 --> 00:29:04.030
So when you think you're restoring to
an earlier point in time and a good,

557
00:29:04.030 --> 00:29:06.870
clean slate,
you're actually just restoring the virus.

558
00:29:06.870 --> 00:29:09.310
So disable System Restore.

559
00:29:09.310 --> 00:29:11.020
Remediate the infected system.

560
00:29:11.020 --> 00:29:15.210
A couple things that you'll have to do
is update the anti-malware software.

561
00:29:15.210 --> 00:29:16.710
Definitions have to be up to date for

562
00:29:16.710 --> 00:29:19.410
you to be able to define what a virus is,
right?

563
00:29:19.410 --> 00:29:22.530
And then use your scanner
removal techniques.

564
00:29:22.530 --> 00:29:24.070
It could be safe mode.

565
00:29:24.070 --> 00:29:26.980
Could be an offline environment
like a preinstallation environment

566
00:29:26.980 --> 00:29:29.950
like the Windows Defender Offline where
you load the optical drive in and

567
00:29:29.950 --> 00:29:30.690
you boot to that.

568
00:29:30.690 --> 00:29:32.340
You don't even load the operating system.

569
00:29:33.720 --> 00:29:37.940
Then once that's done,
make sure you schedule your scans.

570
00:29:37.940 --> 00:29:42.580
Not only run your scans then but
schedule your scans, right?

571
00:29:42.580 --> 00:29:46.900
Run your updates, update your
operating system for security patches.

572
00:29:46.900 --> 00:29:49.960
Maybe you've got a problem because
you haven't updated your system.

573
00:29:49.960 --> 00:29:51.970
Make sure you're running
your Windows updates, right?

574
00:29:51.970 --> 00:29:54.080
Patch management is important.

575
00:29:54.080 --> 00:29:56.825
Then the next thing to do is go ahead and
once that's done,

576
00:29:56.825 --> 00:29:59.585
you've remediated the system,
enable System Restore.

577
00:29:59.585 --> 00:30:04.210
Turn that back on and create your restore
point on the nice clean slate, right?

578
00:30:04.210 --> 00:30:09.590
The systems state data is back in a nice,
good, pristine configuration.

579
00:30:09.590 --> 00:30:12.190
So that if this happens after the fact,
and it does,

580
00:30:12.190 --> 00:30:16.635
I mean it's not anything that,
sometimes you can avoid it.

581
00:30:16.635 --> 00:30:18.620
Sometimes you can implement
preventative measures, but

582
00:30:18.620 --> 00:30:22.310
sometimes your best effort still
isn't gonna solve it completely.

583
00:30:22.310 --> 00:30:26.490
So enable System Restore,
create a system restore point.

584
00:30:26.490 --> 00:30:29.740
Last but not least, educate the end user.

585
00:30:29.740 --> 00:30:36.490
Remember, when anything in security,
the first line of defense is awareness.

586
00:30:36.490 --> 00:30:39.773
And awareness doesn't happen
without educating the user.

587
00:30:39.773 --> 00:30:41.931
And also keep in mind
continuous communication.

588
00:30:41.931 --> 00:30:46.060
This isn't in the steps, just an extra
one cuz this is a very redundant process,

589
00:30:46.060 --> 00:30:46.930
all right?

590
00:30:46.930 --> 00:30:49.910
Education breeds awareness and

591
00:30:49.910 --> 00:30:53.580
communication keeps that process going,
education and communication.

592
00:30:53.580 --> 00:30:55.540
So it's very, very cyclic,
it's very redundant.

593
00:30:55.540 --> 00:30:58.290
Remember, it's never
a destination to be reached,

594
00:30:58.290 --> 00:31:01.040
security is only a journey
to be traveled upon.

595
00:31:01.040 --> 00:31:02.820
Fantastic, awesome information.

596

Troubleshooting PC security issues
inside of the Accelerated A+ series.

597
00:31:07.700 --> 00:31:09.440
Make sure you watch every single episode.

598
00:31:09.440 --> 00:31:11.190
Wes does an awesome job, doesn't he?

599
00:31:11.190 --> 00:31:12.030
He really does.

600
00:31:12.030 --> 00:31:14.650
And listen, thank you for
watching ITProTV.

601
00:31:14.650 --> 00:31:17.170
Remember, a good IT pro

602

I'm Zach Memos.

a person that just walked

00:06:55.020 --> 00:06:57.730

00:07:12.250 --> 00:07:13.220

00:07:16.240 --> 00:07:18.780

00:07:18.780 --> 00:07:22.380

00:07:22.380 --> 00:07:26.280

00:07:26.280 --> 00:07:29.030

When applicable avoid slang, right, try

It can be problematic in the fact

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes walk through troubleshooting theory covered in the A+ exam.
